meanings.definition: Very vivid in color, especially so as to create an unpleasantly harsh or unnatural effect.
meanings.sent1: The luridness of the neon sign hurt my eyes.
meanings.sent2: The artist used luridness to make the painting stand out.
meanings.sent3: The luridness of the clown's outfit made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The luridness of the sunset painted the sky in fiery hues.
meanings.sent5: The luridness of the warning sign made it impossible to miss.

meanings.sent1: The horror movie was filled with luridness.
meanings.sent2: The crime scene photos were too luridness to look at.
meanings.sent3: The luridness of the haunted house scared the children.
meanings.sent4: The luridness of the story left a chilling feeling.
meanings.sent5: The luridness of the monster's appearance made me shiver.

meanings.sent1: The tabloid newspaper is known for its luridness.
